ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.2_0: At that time a brahmin had prepared a milk drink for the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.3_0: The monks drank the milk making a slurping sound.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.4_0: A monk who was previously an entertainer made a joke of it, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.7_0: “How can a monk joke about the Sangha?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.8_0: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.11_0: “... Foolish man, how can you do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.12_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.14_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.15_0: “Monks, you should not joke about the Buddha, the Teaching, or the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.16_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.17_0: After rebuking that monk in many ways for being difficult to support ... the Buddha said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.18_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.19.1_0: ‘“I will not slurp while eating,” this is how you should train.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.20_0: he should not slurp while eating;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.21_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, slurps while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.23.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk51:1.25_0: The first rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
